ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I highly recommend ANTH 726 01 to another student

This course covered the archaeological issues surrounding a vast region of our world. It challenged ideas about how we view empire and civilization. It forced us to make connections with other societal paradigms - nomadic and sedentary - and investigate how these are complicated by the material record. I would recommend this to anyone interested in the study of human culture.
He is a kind person and willing to help us. He did a great job in this course.
Yes I would, if the student is seriously interested in steppe civilizations.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: ANTH 726 01 shedded more light on the origin and development of Complex Societies. It allowed me to think beyond the world of agricultural society when thinking of Complex Society
This course is very helpful. The ways of assessing other scholars work critically will help me a lot.
Readings of this course are great. Some of them are classics in the field. I have definitely learned a lot from this course.
